question.text: Mr. Dauoud is expected to ------- at the conference center in Dubai at 11:00 A.M.

answer.explanation: Question about phrasal verb. In the answers given, there are "get", "arrive" and "come"  with prepositions at. We consider the meaning of each verb phrase to choose the correct answer.

question.text: The software is easy to learn and ------- increases employee productivity.

answer.explanation: The blank is before a verb so there is a missing adverb modifier for that verb.

question.text: The budget will be made ------- on June 9 after a final audit by the finance committee.

answer.explanation: Questions about vocabulary. Need to rely on the meaning to choose the right answer.

question.text: Eun-Yi Roh ------ to assistant deputy attorney after last week's performance review.

answer.explanation: The verb "Promote" means "to promote" and is a transitive verb so it must have an object. However, behind the position to fill is no object, so we will choose the verb in the passive form.

question.text: Mr. Ling has ------- requested funding for airport terminal improvements.

answer.explanation: It is easy to see that the current usage has completed so you can use yet or already. However, this sentence has a positive meaning so it is already selected

question.text: The ------- course on coaching is taught by Lee Wallies at the Peyton Soccer Club.

answer.explanation:
The blank is before a noun => Need an adjective to modify for the noun. The adjective of "introduce" is "introductory" which means "opening"
So the correct answer is D

question.text: Most of the morning ---------- will take place on the second floor, near the conference registration desk.

answer.explanation: Vocabulary question, based on meaning to select the correct answer

question.text: Mr. Tanaka has decided to employ a payroll service because it is becoming too difficult to manage the payroll accounts -------.

answer.explanation: This sentence is full of elements so it is impossible to fill in the blank with the subject, object or adjective. Excluding those options, only the reflexive pronoun "himself" is justified.

question.text: Filmmakers must obtain written consent ------ use a corporate logo.

answer.explanation: need to rely on the meaning of the phrases to choose the correct answer

question.text: To satisfy different tastes, we strive to offer a ------- assortment of brands.

answer.explanation:
The blank is before a noun
=> Need an adjectives to modify meaning to that noun.

question.text: To avoid unexpected -------, ask the hotel desk clerk to explain which services are complimentary.

answer.explanation: Vocabulary question. Based on the meaning to choose the right answer.

question.text: For ------- residents who use street parking, permits are available at city hall.

answer.explanation:
The blank is before a noun, so it can be an adjective or pronoun. "Residents" is the plural noun => can be excluded (B).
With the other options, the object "them" is completely inappropriate, "when" is used to talk about time so it cannot be used here. Only the pronoun that indicates "those" is possible before the plural noun in this sentence.

question.text: Although they usually leave at 6:00 P.M., the employees are ------- in the store preparing for tomorrow's big event.

answer.explanation:
"almost" is usually before an adjective to indicate the level of the adjective and therefore does not fit this sentence.
It is easy to see that "less" and "easily" do not fit into the meaning. => C

question.text: Renters are most excited about the ------ kitchens in the upgraded units.

answer.explanation: The blank is before a noun => Need an adjective to modify that noun. In the given answers, only "renovated" is an adjective.

question.text: While at Varner Bank, Ms. Uehara had the opportunity to work ------ many influential figures in finance.

answer.explanation:
Word to fill in front of "many influential figures" (many influential figures).
In the alternatives given, "throughout" is used for time or space, "where" is used for location, "despite" used here is completely unreasonable in meaning. Only "with" is the most reasonable.

question.text: Please print your airline ticket once ------ of your credit card payment has been received.

answer.explanation: We see behind the word "once" in this sentence is a clause with an incomplete subject. So there is a missing Noun before "of"

question.text: The ------- warehouse on Front Avenue has been torn down to make room for new construction.

answer.explanation: Vocabulary question. Based on the meaning to choose the right answer.

question.text: Reviewing architectural plans ------- in advance is essential in order to maintain reasonable construction costs.

answer.explanation: The blank is after a noun phrase whose main component is the verb noun so it means action. Therefore, the blank is missing an adverb modifier for that action.

question.text: The cost of the final product nearly doubled ------- a rise in the price of the raw materials used to make it.

question.text:
From: Adam Petrovich
To: Gayan Desoysa
Date: Webnesday, October 11, 11:06 A.M
Subject: Service request

Dear Mr. De Soysa,

I received the service request you submitted on October 9 concerning the flickering hallway light and the broken dishwasher in your apartment. Normally, I try to resolve minor service issues within a day or two of receiving an e-mail request. I am sorry it has taken me so long to reply to you. I was busy all day yesterday because of a broken water pipe on the third floor.
If you would like, I will have my electrician come by and repair your light and dishwasher this week. I can schedule him to visit on October 12 between the hours of 3 P.M. and 5 P.M., or on October 13 between the hours of 9 A.M. and 11 A.M. Please let me know as soon as possible which of these times is most convenient for you. If you will not be at home during these times, let me know if you would like me to let the electrician in, since I have access to your apartment.
Regards,
Adam Petrovich

-----------------------------------

From: Gayan De Soysa
To: Adam Petrovich
Date: Webnesday, October 11, 4:05 P.M
Subject: Re: Service request

Dear Mr. Petrovich,

I had heard about the plumbing issue on the third floor from another tenant, so I was not surprised that it took some time for you to respond. As it turns out, I managed to replace the lightbulb in the hallway on the same day I put in my request, and the light is working fine now. The dishwasher still needs to be repaired, however. I would prefer that the conference the next day and wish to be present during the repair work. Thursday is quite convenient for me, as I will be working from home that day. Please let me know if the electricians is still available that afternoon. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Gayan De Soysa
Apartment #250
Who most likely is Mr. Petrovich?
choices: (B) The manager of a residential building
(D) The supervisor of a plumbing business

answer.text: (B) The manager of a residential building
answer.explanation: In the first email there is a saying “Normally, I try to resolve minor service issues within a day or two of receiving an e-mail request” (Usually, I try to resolve the small service problem within 1 or 2 days of receiving inquiry mail). From there it deduced that Mr. Petrovich was the one handling repair requests in an apartment building. So of the given answers, answer B is the most correct.

question.text: According to the first e-mail, why was Mr. Petrovich's response to Mr. De Soysa delayed?
choices: (A) Mr. Petrovich was out of town.
(B) Mr. Petrovich needed to have his computer fixed.
(C) One of Mr. Petrovich's employees did not report for work.
(D) Another job needed Mr. Petrovich's immediate attention.

answer.text: (D) Another job needed Mr. Petrovich's immediate attention.
answer.explanation:
Information in the sentence “I am sorry it has taken me so long to reply to you. I was busy all day yesterday because of a broken water pipe on the third floor. ” (I'm sorry it took so long to answer. I was busy all day because of a broken water pipe on the 3rd floor.)
So the correct answer is D.

question.text: Why does Mr. Petrovich need information from Mr. De Soysa?

answer.explanation:
In the first email, Mr. Petrovich wrote "Please let me know as soon as possible which of these times is most convenient for you." (Please let me know as soon as possible which time is best for you.)
So, Mr. Petrovich needs to know the time that is right for Mr. Soysa in order to carefully repair the electricity through the repairs.

question.text: When did Mr. De Soysa resolve the problem with his light?

answer.explanation:
In the second email, Mr. Soysa wrote “I managed to replace the lightbulb in the hallway on the same day I put in my request” (I was able to change the ball in the hallway the same day I sent the request) .
And at the beginning of the first email, Mr. Petrovich wrote, “I received the service request you submitted on October 9” (I received a service request that you submitted on October 9).
So, Soysa fixed the light bulb on the filing date, October 9.

question.text: According to the second e-mail, what is Mr. De Soysa planning to do on October 12?

answer.explanation: Mr. Soysa wrote 'Thursday is quite convenient for me, as I will be working from home that day' (Thursday is quite convenient for me, since I will be working from home then). According to the date at the beginning of the email, Wednesday is October 11, so Thursday is October 12. So on October 12, Mr. Soysa will be working from home.

Hello everyone,
The Centerville Food Festival will be held next week from June 4-9. Chef Julian Heeley from Forest Inn Restaurant is no longer able to attend and provide cooking demonstrations at the event. Ricardo has graciously volunteered to cover my shifts here at the restaurant next week. and Ravi will be filling in for Yukiko. Meiying has volunteered to work in place of Adam on Wednesday, June 5. However, Adam's shifts on Thursday and Friday are still not covered. Would someone be able to help out with this? Please let me know as soon as possible.

Melanie

question.text:
From: Alton Gilman
To: Myeong Kwan
Date: July 21
Subject: Follow-up

Dear Mr. Kwan,

We spoke briefly after your session at the spring World Pipelines Conference about your company, Krestarr Group, organizing a training session for my engineering team at DQR Corporation. We had talked about two potential sessions, one on regulations for pipeline engineers regarding land use and one on the impact of pipelines on the environment. I would really like to make this happen when you are in Alberta for the fall conference.
The Krestarr Group Web site states that your company's consulting fees are $500 for sessions with up to 10 participants, $750 for sessions with up to 15 participants, $1,000 for sessions with up to 20 participants, and $1,250 sessions with more than 20 participants. Is this information correct? I am looking forward to your prompt reply.

Sincerely,
Alton Gilman

--------------------------------------

From: Myeong Kwan
To: Alton Gilman
Date: July 22
Subject: Re: Follow up

Dear Mr. Gilman,

I would be happy to give a session on land-use regulations to your team. My colleague, Aisha Wright, who handles environmental-impact training for our consulting firm, is also available. We will be at the conference on September 27 and 28. There's no guarantee that conference sessions would end early enough for us to give an evening workshop on those days. So it would probably be easiest for us to arrange for a session either right before or immediately after the conference.
I am available to give the training on the 26th, or Ms. Wright, who is staying in Alberta for a few days after I leave, could present her training session on the 29th. The training fees listed in your e-mail are correct. in the future you may be interested in additional seminars we offer on other topics of interest to environmental engineers, such as maintaining environmental sustainability and how to construct buildings that are energy efficient.
Please confirm which date and training session would be best for your company. I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best,
Myeong Kwan

---------------------------------------------
 
Training Session Schedule
Session Presenter: Myeong Kwan
Date: September 26
Time: 9:00 A.M-4:30 P.M(lunch break 12:00 P.M-1:00 P.M)
Location: Keats Conference Contre Conference Room 26B
Number of Participants:   Eighteen engineers

Information in the first sentence of the first email “We spoke briefly after your session at the spring World Pipelines Conference about your company, Krestarr Group, organizing a training session for my engineering team at DQR Corporation ”(We did a quick talk after your session at the World Pipelines spring conference about your company, Krestarr Group, which hosted a training session for my engineering team at DQR Corporation.)

question.text:
From: Marjorie Greer
To: Antonio Lippert
Subject: Meeting
Date: January 10

Dear Mr. Lippert,

Here are a few points I'd like to cover at our upcoming meeting. The lease on our current building expires this year, so we will need to begin moving into the Walden Street location as soon as the construction is completed. Although our budget for this project is extremely tight, we are committed to an aesthetically pleasing design. Also, the local community board needs assurance that this project will be contained in terms of construction dirt and noise, which could be disruptive to those who live and work in the neighborhood.
Our team was impressed with the work they saw on the tour of LKO Design's past projects in the city, and we hope we will be able to come to an agreement.
Sincerely,
MarjorirGreer, President
Permia Systems

-----------------------------------------------

January 12
MEETING NOTES
Attending
LKO Design: Antonio Lippert, Bjarte Nielsen
Permia Systems: Marjorie Greer, Lisa Ming
Purpose
Determine next steps for Walden Street construction project
Decisions
LKO will evaluate whether it is possible to build onto the existing structure and will draw up an initial budget.
If the project is determined to be too expensive to undertake, Permia Systems will pay for the assessment;

------------------------------------------

Amazing Transformation
(November 28) - Those who remember the vacant Quinn Office Services building on Walden Street may find it hard to believe that most of that squat, dull building still stands. That's because the old building is hidden beneath the stunning new national headquarters of Permia Systems, which is now nearly complete. LKO Design was able to use the old building's foundation and some of its existing structure.
“This was important because the client wanted to avoid disturbance to the community by minimizing the noise and dust," said Bjarte Nielsen, design engineer for LKO Design. "The first thing we did was access the structure. Our preliminary research indicated that we would be able to save the foundation and the main support walls, which helped us attain the client's goal." – By Juno Pelletier
In the e-mail, the word "cover" in paragraph 1, line 1, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation:
The word "cover" in this context means "includes, covers"
"Here are a few points I'd like to cover at our upcoming meeting ”(Here are a few points that I want to cover in our upcoming meeting).
So, in this position the "cover" can be replaced by a "discuss" which is most appropriate
